summary: This bill, the 9/11 Responder and Survivor Health Funding Correction Act of 2025, primarily focuses on amending the World Trade Center Health Program. It expands mental health condition certification flexibility by allowing licensed mental health providers to conduct evaluations. It clarifies enrollment calculations by excluding deceased individuals. It adjusts funding formulas for the program through 2090 and mandates a report to Congress regarding the program's long-term budgetary needs, including recommendations for funding adjustments. It also includes technical amendments related to remaining fund amounts.
